page.title: 05Barras Heath Market
page.content: The Barras Heath Wholesale Market is in Mercer Avenue Stoke Heath.Built in 1954 it covers 7 acres.The lorries go down a drive to the gatehouse and are checked in.There is a oneway system round the outside of the 109 stalls, each of which face the centre of the market for displaying goods,with unloading bays at the outside.The stalls are rented from Coventry Corporation.Goods are sold to retailers from all over the Midlands. The market is open 24hrs a day for unloading.The selling hours are from 5-30am to 1pm.During these times the stalls display vegetables, fruit, flowers and fish.Most of the flowers come in refrigerated lorries from Lincolnshire. Most of the vegetables are English.Fruit comes from all over the world, including Jamaican bananas.
